name: Chef
description:
Chef is a powerful automation platform that transforms infrastructure into code. Whether youâ€™re operating in the cloud, on-premises, or in a hybrid environment, Chef automates how infrastructure is configured, deployed, and managed across your network, no matter its size.
This app creates a single Chef VM running centos 7.
#### License:
* Apache License 2.0
#### Hardware Requirement:
* By default, one VM with 2 vCPU, 4GB RAM
#### Resources Installed:
* Chef Server 12.17.5
#### Operating System:
* CentOS Linux release 7.4.1708
* Select the [AWS AMI](https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace/fulfillment?productId=b7ee8a69-ee97-4a49-9e68-afaee216db2e&ref_=dtl_psb_continue) according to the region.
#### Platform:
* AHV
* AWS
#### Lifecycle:
* NA
#### Limitations:
* No lifecycle management actions.
* Single VM chef server. HA not available.
#### Other Instructions:
* Other Instruction: Open port number 443 in Firewall/Security group.
#### Accessibility:
* https://[IP_ADDRESS]
* Login Creds Default: chefadmin [chefadmin]
author: Nutanix
